title: Fetch TV Touchdown : DAZN Integration Delivers Exclusive NFL Game Pass
body_text:
Fetch TV has announced the addition of DAZN, a sports entertainment platform, to its service. This brings the total number of available apps on Fetch to twenty-three. DAZN is currently available on the new Fetch Mini G5 and is expected to come to Mini 4K and Mighty soon.
DAZN offers a range of sports content through various pricing options. Users can register for free to access select live matches and replays from top international leagues, UEFA Champions League highlights, and women’s sports.
Pay-per-view events, including high-profile boxing matches, will be available for purchase. Subscription options provide access to additional sports content including MMA, basketball, motorsport, and more.
Pricing for DAZN subscriptions starts at $13.99 per month for a 12-month plan, with options for a monthly pass at $21.99 and an annual plan at $139.99.
DAZN is also the exclusive provider of NFL Game Pass outside the USA, offering complete NFL coverage. NFL Game Pass is available as a standalone package or as an add-on to a DAZN subscription, priced at $28.99 for the Weekly Pro or $279.99 for the Season Pro.
Fetch TV now offers over 100 channels, 23 streaming apps, 20 on-demand ‘channel apps’, a movie store with over 11,000 titles, and a TV store with over 100 shows. The new Fetch Mini G5 is available through various retailers and service providers.
Fetch TV, founded in Sydney in 2008, operates as a joint venture between the Telstra Group and Astro Holdings. It currently serves over 600,000 customers and aims to reach 1 million subscribers as Telstra migrates its Telstra TV base to the Fetch platform.
DAZN, which focuses on European football, women’s football, boxing, MMA, and NFL coverage outside the USA, views Australia as a rapidly developing market for its services.
